head.title: Death Row: No Room for Error

hedline.hl1: Death Row: No Room for Error

abstract.p: George Farren letter says death penalty should be prohibited in United States and condemned by United Nations (July 7 article)

block.p: Re ''U.S. Plans Delay in First Execution in Four Decades'' (front page, July 7):
Re ''U.S. Plans Delay in First Execution in Four Decades'' (front page, July 7):

Although the discussion of the fairness of the death penalty is laudable, the discussion we should be having is how to achieve the complete unacceptability of the death penalty by all of the world's peoples under any and all conditions.

A unanimous condemnation of punishment by death should eventually eliminate the death penalty. A place to start would be the prohibition of capital punishment in the United States, followed by the demand of the United Nations that all member countries condemn capital punishment. One would hope that these actions would start human society down a better road for the future.
